sources.title: "So This is Paris" (1926) director Ernst Lubitsch, with Monte Blue, Patsy Ruth Miller
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   The film features Patsy Ruth Miller, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.     "So This is Paris" is an entertaining comedy starring Monte Blue, Patsy Ruth Miller, Lilyan Tashman, George Beranger, Myrna Loy, Sidney D'Albrook, Max Barwyn and others.         To conceal their extramarital flirtations the four members of two married couples get entangled in a web of lies and deceit.    The film was created by the renowned director Ernst Lubitsch.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. metadata.Plot: Georgette lives in Paris with her rather unexciting and effeminate husband, an actor and interpretive dancer. Meanwhile, Suzanne lives across the street and reads romance novels while dreaming of someone more exciting than her own lackluster spouse Maurice. Each woman happens across the other's husband and begins her dream affair. Four people, each cheating on their spouse, and none of them is aware that their own spouse is cheating. Who will find out first, and how?
metadata.Writer: Henri Meilhac, Ludovic Halévy, Hanns Kräly
metadata.Actors: Monte Blue, Patsy Ruth Miller, George Beranger
